justification: Spoofing clients could disrupt configurations, but requires network access and authentication bypass.
recommendations: Enforce TLS for all client-server communication; Implement certificate-based authentication for clients; Monitor for anomalous client behavior

justification: Compromised database exposes credentials and node data across the entire infrastructure.
recommendations: Encrypt sensitive data at rest; Implement role-based access controls; Enable audit logging for database access

justification: Tampered cookbooks could execute arbitrary code across all managed nodes.
recommendations: Validate cookbook inputs rigorously; Implement digital signing for cookbooks; Use least-privilege execution contexts

threat_title: Denial of Service via Resource Exhaustion
justification: Overwhelming API requests could disrupt configuration management for all nodes.
recommendations: Implement rate limiting for API requests; Monitor for unusual traffic patterns; Use auto-scaling for server resources

justification: Compromised clients could grant attackers access to server resources.
recommendations: Enforce strict client authentication; Regularly update client software; Implement network segmentation
